channel.title: Compile problem
channel.description: okay, so ive been tryin to get my compiler to work for a couple weeks now :confused: ive tryed everything.. i downloaded like all of the correct javas .. it still dosnt detect it? does any1 know why?

item.title: Compile problem
item.dc:creator: @Mooshy Mooshy
item.description:
@Mooshy wrote:

well to be honest, most people see they need jdk, they download the most updated one. what you need to download is :The Java SE Development Kit (JDK) includes the Java Runtime Environment (JRE) and command-line development tools that are useful for developing applets and applications.

so http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp and look for that description

Read full topic

item.title: Compile problem
item.dc:creator: @fallen455 fallen455
item.description:
@fallen455 wrote:

here i have one that works copy this and put in ur old one

if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit

Read full topic

item.title: Compile problem
item.dc:creator: @CrnJacKer CrnJacKer
item.description:
@CrnJacKer wrote:

are u sure the compiler sets the correct path to your compiler?

to know, right click on it and press “edit”.

-CrnJacKer
